original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that [this teaching] comes immediately after the first yoga samādhi.

analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro pa 'dul pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor la ltos pa'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam par snang mdzad do //

original: des byin gyis brlabs pa ni nus par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs pa ni nus par mdzad pa'o //

analyzed: gang gi ting nge 'dzin ming 'di skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who enters into the meditative concentration called by this name, that is, the meditative concentration,

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni de ma thag 'chad par 'gyur pa'i blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni de ma thag 'chad par 'gyur pa'i blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: this is the abiding in the mind just explained.

original: rang gi rig pa dam pa gsungs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa dam pa gsungs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The statement of the sublime intuition is the explanation.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi chos kyi dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi chos kyi dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i phyir /
translated: The Transcendent Lord Vairochana, in order to emanate his own Dharma mandala having the nature of the lotus family,

translated: Then, the Bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, with a vajra in his heart, entered the samādhi called “Vajra-born wisdom of all the tathāgatas” and recited this true awareness:

original: @70b de nas dkyil 'khor de 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi thugs ka'i padma las sprul nas /
analyzed: @70b de nas dkyil 'khor de 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi thugs ka'i padma las sprul nas /
translated: Then, that maṇḍala emanated from the lotus in the heart of the noble Avalokiteśvara

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la snga ma bzhin du phul lo //

original: de ltar phyag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje snying po dang / rdo rje spyan dang / rdo rje sna tshogs rnams kyi rang rang gi rig pa dam pa rnams gsungs nas /

translated: Thus, Vajrapāṇi, Vajragarbha, Vajranetra, and Vajraviśva each recited their own true awareness.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi thugs ka'i padma las 'gro pa 'dul ba dang gtsug phud sangs rgyas dang / padma ting nge 'dzin dang / padma don yod dbang phyug gi dkyil 'khor rnams padma'i rigs kyi chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs su sprul nas /

translated: The Bhagavat emanated from the lotus at the heart of the noble Avalokiteśvara the maṇḍalas of Lokanātha, Uṣṇīṣa-Buddha, Padma-Samādhi, and Padma-Amoghīśvara in the form of the Dharma maṇḍala of the Padma family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phul pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phul pa yin no //
translated: He offered them to all the Tathāgatas.

original: de la rang gi rigs kyi chos 'byung pa ni /
analyzed: de la rang gi rigs kyi chos 'byung pa ni /
translated: The Dharma arising from one’s own family is

analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor las 'byung ba gang yin pa'i rig pa dam pa 'di de bzhin du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the sublime knowledge that arises from the Dharma maṇḍala of Lokanātha.

original: de la de nas yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la de nas yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Bhagavat, having entered the samādhi called “Lotus of the Dharma of All the Tathāgatas,”

original: aom badzra karma dharmma h'um zhes bstan pa'i bar gyi gzhung de tsam gyis 'gro pa 'dul pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: aom badzra karma dharmma h'um zhes bstan pa'i bar gyi gzhung de tsam gyis 'gro pa 'dul pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By just this much of the text up to “Oṃ vajra karma dharma hūṃ,” the second meditative stabilization called “supreme king of maṇḍalas” of the Dharma maṇḍala for taming transmigrators has been explained.

original: snga ma bzhin du bsdu pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bsdu pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the gathering, consecration, and so on, as before, is the third meditative stabilization called “supreme king of actions.”

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa'o //
translated: Then is in the context.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: This refers to the explanation that will occur, abiding in the mind.

analyzed: rang gi chos kyi dkyil 'khor du gsungs shing 'chad par 'gyur ro //

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /

analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa'i rjes thogs la zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is taught as follows.

original: 'gro pa 'dul pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i 'gro pa 'dul pa'i rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor dang / de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la nyin re zhing thun bzhi'i sbyor pas chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sngags rnams re re zhing bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro pa 'dul pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i 'gro pa 'dul pa'i rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor dang / de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la nyin re zhing thun bzhi'i sbyor pas chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sngags rnams re re zhing bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: Having performed the yoga of one's own deity as explained in the great maṇḍala of Vinayaka, and having performed the great yoga as explained therein, one should recite each of the mantras of the Dharma maṇḍala one hundred thousand times in four sessions each day.

original: de'i rjes thogs la nyi ma bdun dkyil 'khor 'di bsgoms la /
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs la nyi ma bdun dkyil 'khor 'di bsgoms la /
translated: After that, one should meditate on this maṇḍala for seven days.

original: de nas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should draw it.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu de'i phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu de'i phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word then means for that reason.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro pa 'dul pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa med na /🔽des 'dul pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams kyi mngon @71a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro pa 'dul pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa med na / des 'dul pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams kyi mngon @71a * //
translated: Because without entering the Dharma maṇḍala of Vinayaka,🔽the realm of sentient beings to be tamed by him will not accomplish the desired goal of spiritual powers.

original: par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi don 'grub par mi 'gyur bas rgyu de'i phyir rab tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi don 'grub par mi 'gyur bas rgyu de'i phyir rab tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, it should be fully explained.

original: ye shes dkyil 'khor dam pa ste //
analyzed: ye shes dkyil 'khor dam pa ste //
translated: The supreme maṇḍala of wisdom

original: zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mchog go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mchog go //

original: rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra bar ni //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra bar ni //
translated: Like the Vajra Realm,

analyzed: zhes bya ba las sprul pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor ni 'dir rdo rje dbyings yin la de dang mtshungs pas na /

analyzed: rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra bar ni // chos kyi ye shes zhes brjod do //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du ni //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad srad bu bre //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor thams cad srad bu bre bar bya'o //

original: de yi dbus su bri ba ni //
analyzed: de yi dbus su bri ba ni //
translated: In the center of that, one should draw

analyzed: ye shes rdo rje de bzhin gshegs //

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor ba des de nas thig btab la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor ba des de nas thig btab la /

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad de'i phyogs dang / mtshams rnams thams cad du / sems dpa' che rnams cho ga bzhin //

analyzed: sna tshogs dbang phyug la sogs pa //

translated: should be drawn absorbed in samādhi.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor thams cad thig btab la khro bo'i lta bas bltas te /🔽de nyid kyi sgo rnams byas la /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor thams cad thig btab la khro bo'i lta bas bltas te / de nyid kyi sgo rnams byas la /

analyzed: tshon sna rnam pa lngas dkyil 'khor bris te /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba'i gnas su rnam par snang mdzad sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ji skad bshad pa'i seng ge'i gdan gyi steng du rdo rje rtse lnga pa chur gnas pa la /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, draw Vairocana with the characteristics explained previously, on a lion throne as explained previously, with a five-pointed vajra the size of a grain of rice in his heart center, outside the heart center.

original: rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: de'i phyogs rnams su chos kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa rigs kyi phyag rgya bzhi pa dang / 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil @71b 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i tshul gyis lha thams cad kyi gnas su padma dang zla ba'i gdan la de rnams kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa chur gnas pa la 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: In the directions of that [wheel], one should draw the four clans' consorts, such as Dharmavajra, and in the locations of all the deities, on lotus and moon seats, the five-tined wisdom vajras of those [consorts], abiding in water, such as Vinayaka,

original: padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa dang / byams pa la sogs pa rnams rang gi mtshan ma nas 'bras kyi tshad tsam snying ga'i phyi rol du 'jog cing rdo rje skyil mo krung du bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa dang / byams pa la sogs pa rnams rang gi mtshan ma nas 'bras kyi tshad tsam snying ga'i phyi rol du 'jog cing rdo rje skyil mo krung du bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: up to Padmakesa, endowed with the previously explained characteristics, and Maitreya, etc., with their own emblems, the size of a grain of rice, placed outside the heart, and drawn in vajra posture.

original: snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du /
translated: As before,

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin la sogs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin la sogs //
translated: the buddhas, vajra holders, etc.,

original: thams cad snyoms par zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: thams cad snyoms par zhugs pa ste //
translated: all enter into union,

original: ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa dang // phyag gnyis rdo rje bcing bas bcings //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa dang // phyag gnyis rdo rje bcing bas bcings //
translated: with the two hands bound in the vajra bond.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu shes par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa brjod pa ste /

analyzed: slob dpon rang nyid 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i cho gas ji lta ba bzhin du zhugs la nas 'bras tsam gyi rdo rje padma'i dbang bskur blangs la cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad par bya'o //
translated: immediately after that, the master himself should enter the maṇḍala of the Tamer of Beings according to the rite of entry, and having taken the empowerment of the vajra and lotus the size of a grain, he should perform all the rites.

analyzed: de nas bsdu ba byas la mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod de /
translated: Then, having performed the dissolution, he should praise with the one hundred and eight names.🔽Immediately after that, having performed the extensive rite of summoning and so forth in this maṇḍala of the Lotus Family,

analyzed: de'i rjes thogs nyid la padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor 'dir dgug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas par byas nas zhes bya ba ni rta mgrin gyi lcags kyus dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dgug pa dang / don yod zhags pas gzhug pa dang /
translated: with the iron hook of Hayagrīva, he should summon all the deities of the maṇḍala,🔽with the noose of Amoghasiddhi, he should induct them,

analyzed: padma'i lcags sgrog gis bcing ba dang / padma 'bebs pas dbang du bya ba dang / padma gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bsal la /
translated: Bind with the lotus shackles,🔽control with the lotus rain,🔽and clear away obstacles with the lotus yakṣa.🔽

original: ra ba dang dra ba bya'o //
analyzed: ra ba dang dra ba bya'o //
translated: Bind with the lotus hook, summon with the lotus noose, fetter with the lotus shackles, control with the lotus rainmaker, and clear away obstacles with the lotus yakṣa.

original: de nas padma'i khu tshur gyis sgo bcad la /
analyzed: de nas padma'i khu tshur gyis sgo bcad la /
translated: Then, with the lotus fist, close the door.

original: padma'i srung bas bsrung ba thams cad yang dag par bsrungs la /
analyzed: padma'i srung bas bsrung ba thams cad yang dag par bsrungs la /
translated: With the lotus protection, protect all the protections.

analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i lha thams cad la mchod yon dang zhabs bsil phul nas /

analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bsgrubs te /

original: de nas chos dang las dang / phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis kyang rgyas btab la /
analyzed: de nas chos dang las dang / phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis kyang rgyas btab la /

analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya rnams kyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dbang bskur la /
translated: consecrate them with the consecration seals of Vairocana and so forth.

original: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod de /

analyzed: slob ma 'jug pa'i gnang ba nod pa ni dgug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: request permission to induct the disciples. This is called the extensive rite of summoning and so forth.

original: de ltar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas /
translated: Having done that,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bcug ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bcug ste /

analyzed: 'di skad du khyod kyis gzhan su la yang ma brjod cig ces bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul @72a * //

analyzed: ba'i dkyil 'khor chen bor 'jug pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'dir rdo rje padma nas 'bras kyi tshad tsam slob ma rnams la byin nas zhes bya ba dang / cho ga lhag ma rnams ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa nyid gzung bar bya'o //

translated: Here, one should give the vajra and lotus to the disciples, the size of a grain of rice, and the remaining rites should be understood just as they are explained in the great maṇḍala of Subjugation of Maras.

analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga rgyas pa dang slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the extensive ritual of the master's actions and the procedure for inducting the disciples,

analyzed: da ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor du dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams la /

analyzed: de las bshad pa'i dngos grub kyi ye shes rnams slob dpon gyis bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa'i phyir /

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes thogs la zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de'i ye shes bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i ye shes bskyed par bya ste /

original: gang 'dod ces dri par bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod ces dri par bya'o //

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug snyoms zhugs la //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug snyoms zhugs la //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad ba'i cho gas rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: one should perform the yoga of one’s deity by the rite explained in the great maṇḍala of the Subjugation of the Three Worlds.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: aom padma dzny'a na hri da ya a'a be sha / zhes bya ba'i snying po 'dis snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje padma bskyed pa /
translated: Having generated a vajra lotus on a moon disc at the heart with this essence mantra,

original: de nyid zlos shing bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de nyid zlos shing bsgoms nas /
translated: one should meditate while reciting it.

analyzed: de nas zla ba nya la mtshan thog thag bsgoms na de 'grub par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: padma'i ting nge 'dzin thob par //

analyzed: de ma thag tu myur bar 'dir //

original: zhes bya ba la 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here means

analyzed: skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe'o //

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug snyoms zhugs la //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug snyoms zhugs la //
translated: Having entered into union with Lokeśvara,

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: as before.

original: dpral bar padmo bsgoms byas te /🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpral bar padmo bsgoms byas te / zhes bya ba ni /

translated: With the essence “Oṃ, consecration of the lotus knowledge, enter,” one should meditate on the vajra lotus as before on the moon maṇḍala on the forehead. Then one should accomplish it.

analyzed: 'jig rten dbang gi ting 'dzin gyis //

original: lce la padmo bsgoms nas kyang /
analyzed: lce la padmo bsgoms nas kyang /

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas la /
translated: as before, one should accomplish everything.

analyzed: 'jig rten dbang gi ting 'dzin gyis //

original: spyi gtsug padmo bsgoms nas kyang //
analyzed: spyi gtsug padmo bsgoms nas kyang //
translated: having meditated on a lotus on the crown,

translated: having performed just that yoga of one's deity,

analyzed: aom padma dzny'a na aushn'i sha a'a be sha zhes bya bas spyi gtsug gi gnas su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rdo rje padma bskyed la snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: with OṀ PADMA JÑĀNA USNĪSHA ĀVEŚA, one should generate a vajra lotus on the crown of the head on a moon disc, and accomplish as before.

analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du mtshan thog thag bsgoms na ni mi snang ba'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //

original: nam mkha' 'am ni phyogs gzhan du //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'am ni phyogs gzhan du //
translated: In space or another direction,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of one’s deity.

original: aom padma ra tha /
analyzed: aom padma ra tha /

original: nam mkha' 'am ni phyogs gzhan du //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'am ni phyogs gzhan du //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin du rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /

analyzed: aom dzny'a na padma grihna /

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i snying po 'dis nam mkha' la sogs pa'i phyogs su padma sprul la /

analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du bsgrubs na gang gi tshe mthong ba de blangs na mi snang bar 'gyur ro // nam mkha' 'am ni phyogs gzhan du ;

analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin du rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /

analyzed: khu tshur gnyis kyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i tshul gyis las kyi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //

translated: Having entered into equipoise on that, he spoke this knowledge mantra.

analyzed: de las byung ba ni rang gi rigs kyi las la byung ba'i rang gi rig pa dam pa'o //

translated: Thus, Vajrapāṇi, Vajra Essence, Vajra Eye, Vajra Variety, Lokanātha, Uṣṇīṣa Buddha, Samādhi Lotus, and Padmanātha, urged the noble Avalokiteśvara,

analyzed: rang gi thugs ka'i padma las snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor sprul nas phul ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /

translated: This passage from “Oṃ viśva karma samaya hūṃ” up to the end is the second meditative stabilization called “supreme royal maṇḍala of karma,” the maṇḍala of the maṇḍala of the subjugation of the world.

original: de nas bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pas ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pas ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the third meditative stabilization called “supreme royal karma” should be understood through the summary, consecration, and so forth.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the three meditative stabilizations,

original: da ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i las kyi dkyil 'khor du dam tshig dang dbang bskyur ba thob ba rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i las kyi dkyil 'khor du dam tshig dang dbang bskyur ba thob ba rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain that the powers taught in the karma maṇḍala of the subjugation of the world are to be accomplished by those who have obtained the consecration and the pledge in the karma maṇḍala of the subjugation of the world,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bang ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bang ba'o //
translated: “ Then” means in the context.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'o //
translated: Noble Avalokitesvara is the tamer of beings.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: Here means in the mind.

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor ni rang gi padma'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor ni rang gi padma'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor ro //

original: bshad do zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad do zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'o //
translated: Then means immediately after.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor dang / de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la thun bzhi'i sbyor bas las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rig pa rnams re re zhing yang bzlas pa khri byas nas /🔽phyis las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bsgom pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor dang / de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la thun bzhi'i sbyor bas las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rig pa rnams re re zhing yang bzlas pa khri byas nas / phyis las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bsgom pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Having performed the yoga taught in the Mahayana Mañjusri-tantra and the great maṇḍala of the tamer of beings, and having performed the great yoga taught in that [tantra], and having performed the recitation of each of the karma maṇḍala awarenesses in four sessions,

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor zhag bdun bsgoms pa'i rjes thogs la las kyi dkyil 'khor bri @76a * //
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor zhag bdun bsgoms pa'i rjes thogs la las kyi dkyil 'khor bri @76a * //
translated: one should later cultivate the three types of meditative stabilizations taught in the karma maṇḍala, beginning with the cultivation of the karma maṇḍala for seven days.🔽Immediately after that, one should draw the karma maṇḍala.

original: bar bya'o // de nas ni rgyu de'i phyir te gang gi phyir las kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa med na /
analyzed: bar bya'o // de nas ni rgyu de'i phyir te gang gi phyir las kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa med na /
translated: Then, for that reason, because without entering the mandala of action,

analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir rab tu bshad bya ba /
translated: the powers that are taught in the mandala of action will not be accomplished, therefore it is said,

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor dam pa zhes bya ba'o //

translated: The samādhi of Lokeśvara,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni padma rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma'i ting nge 'dzin nam /🔽de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni padma rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma'i ting nge 'dzin nam / de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Karma Mandala, or the mudra of the deities of that family.🔽 Having formed that, and abiding in that pride, one should say, as

original: de'i nga rgyal gyis gnas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du brjod la ;
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal gyis gnas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du brjod la ;
translated: above, All buddhas and bodhisattvas, and so forth.

original: aom sarbba p'a pam prana sha na dharmma padma /
analyzed: aom sarbba p'a pam prana sha na dharmma padma /
translated: One should say, Om, all sins are purified by the Dharma lotus.

original: zhes bya ba brjod pa de lta bus kyang sdig pa thams cad rab tu 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod pa de lta bus kyang sdig pa thams cad rab tu 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, all sins will be completely destroyed.

original: mdor na gang yang rung ba yi //🔽las kyi phyag rgya legs bcings la //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma nges pa'i dbang phyug gam /
analyzed: mdor na gang yang rung ba yi // las kyi phyag rgya legs bcings la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma nges pa'i dbang phyug gam /
translated: In brief, having formed🔽any karma mudra well,🔽 and so forth refers to the Lotus Lord of the Secrets taught in the Karma

original: de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Mandala, or the karma mudra of the deities of that family.

original: de'i nga rgyal gyis gnas te /
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal gyis gnas te /
translated: Having formed that, and abiding in that pride, one should say, as🔽above, All buddhas and bodhisattvas, and so forth.🔽 One should say, Om, all karma is purified by the Dharma lotus.🔽 In that way, all karma will be completely destroyed.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du brjod cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du brjod cing /
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas and so forth as before.

original: aom sarbba karmm'a a'a ba ra na bi sho dha ya dharmma karmma padma zhes brjod pa de lta bus las kyi sgrib pa kun las rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom sarbba karmm'a a'a ba ra na bi sho dha ya dharmma karmma padma zhes brjod pa de lta bus las kyi sgrib pa kun las rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Saying Om sarva karma ava rana vishodhaya dharma karmapadma like that, all karmic obscurations will be purified.

original: de nas sgrib pa thams cad zad bar 'gyur pa'i ye shes bslab pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nas sgrib pa thams cad zad bar 'gyur pa'i ye shes bslab pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, the wisdom that exhausts all obscurations is to be learned.

original: de la sgrib pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, obscurations are of four kinds:

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa thams cad kyi bag chags kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig gnas pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang / bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu chags ba rnams nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa thams cad kyi bag chags kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig gnas pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang / bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu chags ba rnams nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang /
translated: The obscuration of ripening that is the habitual tendency of all apprehendeds and apprehenders that is concomitant with the all-ground consciousness, the obscuration of afflictions that is the afflicted mind together with delusion about a self, pride in a self, the view of a self, and attachment to a self,

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod ba dang / 'gyod @78a * //🔽pa dang / the tshom rnams yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgrib pa lnga po dang / mtshams med pa lnga dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi las rnams mig dang / rna ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod ba dang / 'gyod @78a * // pa dang / the tshom rnams yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgrib pa lnga po dang / mtshams med pa lnga dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi las rnams mig dang / rna ba dang /
translated: The five obscurations that are concomitant with the mental consciousness are desire, malice, lethargy, sleep, excitation and regret.🔽The four types of karmic obscurations are the five heinous actions and the rejection of the sublime teaching and so on, which are physical and verbal actions concomitant with the eye, ear, nose, tongue and body consciousnesses.

original: sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa'i las kyi sgrib pa ste rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa'i las kyi sgrib pa ste rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: The obscurations are of four types.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag yongs su zad cing 'jig par 'gyur ba des nges pa'i ye shes de slob po //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag yongs su zad cing 'jig par 'gyur ba des nges pa'i ye shes de slob po //
translated: The definitive pristine consciousness of the one who completely exhausts and destroys those four types of obscurations is the training.

original: 'jig rten dbang gi phyag rgya cher //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang gi phyag rgya cher //
translated: The great mudra of the lord of the world

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor ram /🔽de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor byas la /🔽phyis padma'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor ram / de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor byas la / phyis padma'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po'am /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of Subduer of the Three Worlds or the yoga of the family of Subduer of the Three Worlds as explained in the great maṇḍala of Subduer of the Three Worlds.🔽Then, one should bind the great seal of Subduer of the Three Worlds as explained in the maṇḍala of the action of the lotus family,

original: de'i rigs kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings te /🔽de'i phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings te / de'i phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: or the great seal of the family of Subduer of the Three Worlds.🔽One should imagine oneself in the nature of that great seal,

original: de'i rigs kyi lha'i rang bzhin bdag nyid rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi lha'i rang bzhin bdag nyid rnam par bsams te /
translated: or in the nature of the deity of that family.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du brjod cing /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du brjod cing /
translated: As before, one should recite “All buddhas and bodhisattvas in the ten directions” and so forth.

original: shuddha shuddha zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: shuddha shuddha zhes brjod nas /
translated: Reciting “śuddha śuddha,”🔽one should imagine oneself in the nature of emptiness, the door of liberation that is like a reflection.

original: bdag nyid gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsam pa dang / mi bskyod pa bsgoms nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsam pa dang / mi bskyod pa bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on Akṣobhya,

original: aom p'a pam ksha ya padma /
analyzed: aom p'a pam ksha ya padma /
translated: Oṃ, Padma who destroys evil!🔽

original: zhes bya ba'i snying po brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i snying po brjod do //
translated: The essence mantra is Om, the lotus of sins!

original: de ltar bzlas pas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi gegs su gyur pa'i las rnams dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //🔽'jig rten dbang gi ting 'dzin gyis //🔽las kyi dam tshig bcings nas na ;
analyzed: de ltar bzlas pas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi gegs su gyur pa'i las rnams dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dag par 'gyur ro // 'jig rten dbang gi ting 'dzin gyis // las kyi dam tshig bcings nas na ;
translated: Thus, by reciting it, the obscurations of karma and of ripening that are obstacles to the meditative stabilization of emptiness are purified.

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i gtsug phud sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor ram /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i gtsug phud sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor ram /
translated: The line Having bound the pledge of action with the meditative stabilization of Lokeśvara and so forth is as before, referring to the Great Maṇḍala of Taming Beings.

original: de'i rigs kyi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /🔽phyis las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i gtsug phud sangs rgyas kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'am /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la / phyis las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i gtsug phud sangs rgyas kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'am /
translated: Having performed the yoga of Uṣṇīṣa Buddha or the yoga of a deity of his family,

original: de'i rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: later bind the pledge seal of Uṣṇīṣa Buddha or the pledge seal of his family as explained in the Action Maṇḍala.

original: rang gi phyag rgya ni sems dpa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid du bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya ni sems dpa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid du bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on one’s seal as having the nature of the form of the deity,

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'i bdag nyid bsgom zhing /🔽buddha buddha zhes bzlas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ces bya ba la sogs @78b pa snga ma bzhin du brjod pa dang / aom aa ba ra na ksha ya padma zhes lan gsum du bzlas pa de lta bus ni nyon mongs pa'i yid dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ji skad du bshad pa'i chags pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'i bdag nyid bsgom zhing / buddha buddha zhes bzlas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ces bya ba la sogs @78b pa snga ma bzhin du brjod pa dang / aom aa ba ra na ksha ya padma zhes lan gsum du bzlas pa de lta bus ni nyon mongs pa'i yid dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ji skad du bshad pa'i chags pa dang /
translated: One should meditate on the reality of the signless gate of liberation, the pristine awareness equal to space.🔽Reciting “buddha buddha” and saying the previous mantra “all buddhas and bodhisattvas” and so on, and reciting “oṃ āvaraṇa kṣaya padma” three times, one will purify the afflictive obscurations together with the afflictive mind, and the karmic obscurations of the previously mentioned attachment,

original: nga rgyal dang / rmongs pa dang / lta ba la sogs pa'i las kyi sgrib ba rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro//🔽'jig rten dbang por snyoms zhugs la //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / rmongs pa dang / lta ba la sogs pa'i las kyi sgrib ba rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro// 'jig rten dbang por snyoms zhugs la //
translated: pride, delusion, and views.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /🔽de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin padma'i rnal 'byor ram /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin padma'i rnal 'byor ram /
translated: “One should enter into meditative absorption as Lokeśvara” and so on.

original: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: One should perform the yoga of the lotus meditative absorption or the yoga of its lineage.

original: phyis las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: phyis las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: Later, one should bind the great seal explained in the Action Tantra,

original: rang gi phyag rgya sems dpa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid du bsgoms nas snga ma bzhin du sdig pa bshags pa byas te /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya sems dpa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid du bsgoms nas snga ma bzhin du sdig pa bshags pa byas te /
translated: and meditate on one’s seal as having the nature of the form of the deity, and confess one’s sins as before.

original: dhi dhi dhi dhi zhes bya ba'i yi ge dhi bzhi brjod cing rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i sgo mngon du byas nas ni ba ra na ksha ya padma zhes lan gsum brjod pa de lta bus
analyzed: dhi dhi dhi dhi zhes bya ba'i yi ge dhi bzhi brjod cing rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i sgo mngon du byas nas ni ba ra na ksha ya padma zhes lan gsum brjod pa de lta bus
translated: One should recite the four syllables dhi dhi dhi dhi, and by manifesting the door of abiding in the perfection of wisdom, which is pure by nature, one should recite three times “Oṃ sarva pāpa svakaṃ svakaṃ kṣapayāmi” (I destroy all my own sins).

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi mtshan nyid kyi sgrib pa rnams rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i sdig pa rnams so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyis spong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi mtshan nyid kyi sgrib pa rnams rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i sdig pa rnams so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyis spong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In this way, one should abandon the sins that are the obstacles to the door of liberation of wishlessness, which are the obscurations characterized by the desire for sense objects, malice, lethargy and sleep, excitement and regret, and doubt, by means of the gnosis of thorough analysis.

original: 'jig rten dbang po'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: By the samadhi of Lokeshvara,

original: las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas kyang //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas kyang //
translated: having bound the karmamudra,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin du /
translated: and so forth.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor byas la las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma nges pa'i dbang phyug gi las kyi phyag rgya dang / de'i rigs kyi las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor byas la las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma nges pa'i dbang phyug gi las kyi phyag rgya dang / de'i rigs kyi las kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of Lokeshvara, bind the karmamudra of Padmanateshvara from the karma mandala, and the karmamudra of his family.

original: rang gi phyag rgya sems dpa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid du bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya sems dpa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid du bsgoms nas /
translated: Meditating on one's mudra in the form of a sattva,

original: snga ma bzhin du sdig pa bshags pa byas te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sdig pa bshags pa byas te /
translated: confess one's negative karma as before.

original: yi ge hi bzhi brjod do //
analyzed: yi ge hi bzhi brjod do //
translated: Recite the four hi syllables.

original: bdag nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du bsgoms te /
analyzed: bdag nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du bsgoms te /
translated: Meditate on oneself as the nature of the gate of liberation, luminosity.

original: aom karmma ksha ya padma /
analyzed: aom karmma ksha ya padma /
translated: Om karmakshaya padma.

original: zhes zlos shing /
analyzed: zhes zlos shing /
translated: Reciting this,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba bsgoms la /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba bsgoms la /
translated: meditate on all phenomena as naturally luminous.

original: mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du gcod pa rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du gcod pa rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The karmas of the heinous crimes and so forth, which obstruct the perfection of diligence, will be purified.

original: de ltar las kyi sgrib pa thams cad sbyang ba byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar las kyi sgrib pa thams cad sbyang ba byas nas /
translated: Having thus purified all karmic obscurations,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mchod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mchod par bya ba yin no //
translated: one should make offerings in order to complete the accumulation of merit.

original: snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal @79a * //🔽'byor gyis las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po'am /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal @79a * // 'byor gyis las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po'am /
translated: As before, through the yoga of Lokeśvara,🔽one should form the great seal of Vināyaka taught in the karma maṇḍala,

original: de'i rigs kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: or the great seal of his family.

original: rang gi phyag rgya sems dpa'i bdag nyid du bsams te /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya sems dpa'i bdag nyid du bsams te /
translated: Visualizing one’s seal as the nature of the bodhisattva,

original: yi ge aom lan bzhi brjod cing rin po che sna bdun la sogs pa'i padma'i sprin sprul la /
analyzed: yi ge aom lan bzhi brjod cing rin po che sna bdun la sogs pa'i padma'i sprin sprul la /
translated: one should emanate clouds of lotuses of the seven precious substances and so forth, reciting the syllable oṃ four times.

original: aom aam karma padma zhes brjod cing des sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom aam karma padma zhes brjod cing des sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Reciting oṃ aṃ karma padma, one should make offerings to all buddhas and bodhisattvas with that.

original: 'jig rten dbang po'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: By the samadhi of Lokeshvara,

original: dam tshig mchog ni bcings nas kyang //
analyzed: dam tshig mchog ni bcings nas kyang //
translated: having bound the supreme commitment,🔽and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor la gnas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor la gnas nas /
translated: In this, having remained in the yoga of Lokeshvara as before,

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i gtsug phud sangs rgyas kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'am /
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i gtsug phud sangs rgyas kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'am /
translated: one binds the commitment seal of Ushnisha-Buddha from the Action Maṇḍala,

original: de'i rigs kyi lha'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi lha'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: or the seal of the deity of his family,

original: yi ge bhu rnam pa bzhi las rin chen padma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i sprin snga ma bzhin du sprul la /
analyzed: yi ge bhu rnam pa bzhi las rin chen padma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i sprin snga ma bzhin du sprul la /
translated: and emanates clouds of offerings such as precious lotuses from the four types of bhū syllables, as before.

original: aom bhu ka ra padma zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: aom bhu ka ra padma zhes brjod pas /
translated: By reciting Oṃ bhūḥ kara pṛthivī,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad des mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad des mchod par bya'o //
translated: one should make offerings to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas with that.

original: 'jig rten dbang por snyoms zhugs la //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang por snyoms zhugs la //
translated: Having entered into equipoise as Lokeshvara,🔽and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang po'i rnal 'byor la gnas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang po'i rnal 'byor la gnas nas /
translated: In this, having remained in the yoga of Lokeshvara as before,

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya chen po 'am /
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya chen po 'am /

analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya sems ma'i bdag nyid du bsgoms nas /

analyzed: yi ge hri rnam pa bzhi bsams la /

analyzed: de nas aom hr'i siddhya zhes bya ba bzlas pas dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //

original: 'jig rten dbang po'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po'i ting 'dzin gyis //

analyzed: dam tshig mchog ni bcings nas ni //

original: yi ge shri rnam pa bzhi las bdag nyid rang gi phyag rgya sems dpar bskyed la /
analyzed: yi ge shri rnam pa bzhi las bdag nyid rang gi phyag rgya sems dpar bskyed la /

analyzed: aom shri siddhya zhes brjod pas rang gi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //

original: 'jig rten dbang po mnyam gzhag par //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po mnyam gzhag par //
translated: In the equipoise of Lokeśvara,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i ting nge 'dzin padma dang / de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings la /

translated: As before, endowed with the yoga of Lochanā, one should form the great seal of the lotus and the deities of her clan as taught in the Action Wheel.

analyzed: yi ge dhi ka rnam pa bzhis rang gi phyag rgya sems dpa'i bdag nyid du khro ba dang ldan par bsams la /

analyzed: de nas aom dhi ka siddhya zhes brjod cing rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa bsgom par bya'o //

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //

original: padma chen po dge ba yi //
analyzed: padma chen po dge ba yi //
translated: The great lotus is virtuous,

original: las kyi phyag rgya bslab par bya //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya bslab par bya //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i padma nges pa'i dbang phyug gi las kyi phyag rgya'am /

original: de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya bcings te /

analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya sems dpa'i bdag nyid du byas nas /

analyzed: yi ge si rnam pa bzhis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du bsgoms la /

analyzed: aom si siddhya zhes brjod cing bdag nyid du bsgoms na dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas gzhan yang de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas / las kyi gsang @80a * //

analyzed: ba'i phyag rgya'i ye shes bstan par bya'o //

original: gsang bas na gsang ba ste /
analyzed: gsang bas na gsang ba ste /
translated: Secret means secret,

original: sems kyi bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: which is the activity of the mind.

original: 'jig rten dbang po snyoms zhugs la //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po snyoms zhugs la //
translated: Having entered into union with the Lord of the World

original: zhes bya ba ni padma rigs kyi lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma rigs kyi lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: refers to the yoga of the deity of the lotus family.

original: bud med kun dang rtse byed cing //
analyzed: bud med kun dang rtse byed cing //

analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /

analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dum bur gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams ni padma rigs kyi phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor du dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the powers taught in the section on the conversion of beings are to be accomplished by one who has obtained the consecration and the commitments in the maṇḍala of the four seals of the lotus family,🔽he says,🔽  Then, the powers taught in the section on the conversion of beings are to be accomplished by one who has obtained the consecration and the commitments in the maṇḍala of the four seals of the lotus family.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga dang slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga dang slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The master's ritual procedures and the ritual procedures for inducting the disciples are taught extensively.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skabs su bab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skabs su bab pa'o //
translated: The word then refers to the present context.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Lord Avalokitdvara is the discipliner of the world.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni @82b blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni @82b blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: This refers to what is present in the mind.

original: phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor ni padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor ni padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The mandala of the four seals is of the nature of the lotus family.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Vairocana's teaching is the explanation.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /🔽'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor dang de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste / 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor dang de las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po byas la /
translated: Then refers to immediately after.

original: snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor ji srid mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor ji srid mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having performed the yoga of the discipliner of the world as explained in the great mandala of the discipliner of the world, and having performed the great yoga as explained therein, one should meditate on the mandala of the four seals as before, until one sees it in actuality.

original: de nas de'i rjes la dkyil 'khor 'di bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i rjes la dkyil 'khor 'di bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, after that, this mandala should be drawn.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then means for that reason.

original: gang gi phyir phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa med na bar ma la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su gzung bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir rab tu bshad bya ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa med na bar ma la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su gzung bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir rab tu bshad bya ba /
translated: The meaning is that if one does not enter the mandala of the four seals, one will not be able to take care of sentient beings who delight in the intermediate.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: phyag rgya bzhi mchog dkyil 'khor te //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi mchog dkyil 'khor te //
translated: The mandala of the supreme four seals.🔽Like the vajra realm,

original: zhes bya'o // rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra pa'o ;
translated: means like the emanated mandala of the four seals.

original: / dkyil 'khor chen po 'dra bar bya //
analyzed: / dkyil 'khor chen po 'dra bar bya //
translated: Like the great mandala,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: means like the great mandala of Subjugation of Maras.

original: phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //
translated: In the center of the mandala of seals,

original: sangs rgyas gzugs ni gzhag par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs ni gzhag par bya //
translated: the form of the Buddha should be placed.

original: de yi phyogs rnams thams cad du //
analyzed: de yi phyogs rnams thams cad du //
translated: In all its directions,

original: rdo rje padmo la sogs bri //
analyzed: rdo rje padmo la sogs bri //
translated: vajra, lotus, and so forth should be drawn.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i bri ba'i cho gas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad padma dang / seng ge'i gdan la phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i snying pos bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i bri ba'i cho gas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad padma dang / seng ge'i gdan la phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i snying pos bri bar bya'o //
translated: This is the mandala of Vairocana, the Blessed One, with lotus and lion throne, drawn with the ritual of drawing explained in the Maṇḍalālamkāra.

original: de'i shar phyogs kyi chal 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gnas su padma dang zla ba'i gdan la padmas mtshan pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa /
analyzed: de'i shar phyogs kyi chal 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gnas su padma dang zla ba'i gdan la padmas mtshan pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa /
translated: In the eastern quarter of that, in the place of Lokanātha, is a five-pronged vajra marked with a lotus on a lotus and moon seat.

original: gtsug phud sangs rgyas kyi gnas su padmas mtshan pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu /
analyzed: gtsug phud sangs rgyas kyi gnas su padmas mtshan pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu /
translated: In the place of Śikhin Buddha, is a wish-fulfilling gem marked with a lotus.

original: padma ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas su rdo rje padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa /
analyzed: padma ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas su rdo rje padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa /
translated: In the place of Padma Samādhi, is a vajra lotus with sixteen petals.

original: padma nges pa'i dbang phyug gi gnas su sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang ljang gu'i kha dog dang ldan pa'i 'dab ma bzhi pa lte ba ni dkar po ste /
analyzed: padma nges pa'i dbang phyug gi gnas su sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang ljang gu'i kha dog dang ldan pa'i 'dab ma bzhi pa lte ba ni dkar po ste /
translated: In the place of Padma Niścayādhipati, is a four-petaled lotus with blue, yellow, red, and green petals, and a white center.

original: 'di ni padma 'dab ma bzhi pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni padma 'dab ma bzhi pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the four-petaled lotus.

original: 'dir 'gro ba 'dul ba las bshad pa'i snying po 'di nyid kyis bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba 'dul ba las bshad pa'i snying po 'di nyid kyis bri bar bya ste /
translated: Here, one should write the essence as explained in the Vinaya of the Mulasarvastivadins.🔽

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas phyogs kun bri ba ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phyogs kun bri ba ni //
translated: “The Buddhas are drawn in all directions,

original: padma'i gnas su gnas pa ni //🔽rdo rje rin chen padmo dang // sna tshogs padmo de bzhin no //
analyzed: padma'i gnas su gnas pa ni // rdo rje rin chen padmo dang // sna tshogs padmo de bzhin no //
translated: dwelling in the abode of the lotus,🔽the vajra, the jewel, the lotus,

original: zhes @83a * //
analyzed: zhes @83a * //
translated: and the variegated lotus, just so.

original: gsungs so // de la snying po ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gsungs so // de la snying po ni 'di yin te /
translated: And the essence is this:

original: aom h'um dhe kre zhes bya ba 'di nyid gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom h'um dhe kre zhes bya ba 'di nyid gzung bar bya'o //
translated: “Oṃ hūṃ dhiḥ.🔽”

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /
translated: “Then” means immediately after.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i slob dpon gyi cho gas slob dpon nyid 'jug pa'i cho ga rjes su bcad la bsdu ba byas te /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i slob dpon gyi cho gas slob dpon nyid 'jug pa'i cho ga rjes su bcad la bsdu ba byas te /
translated: Having performed the master’s self-entry rite with the master’s rite explained in the Taming of the World maṇḍala, one should perform the collection.

original: de nas mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa'i rjes thogs nyid la phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor 'dir dgug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa'i rjes thogs nyid la phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor 'dir dgug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa bya ba'o //
translated: Then, immediately after the praise with the one hundred and eight names, one should perform the extensive rite of summoning and so forth in this maṇḍala of the four seals.

original: de la rta mgrin gyi lcags kyu'i las kyi phyag rgya snga ma bzhin du dgug pa la sogs pa smos pa ni /🔽don yod zhags pa'i las kyi phyag rgyas gzhug pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la rta mgrin gyi lcags kyu'i las kyi phyag rgya snga ma bzhin du dgug pa la sogs pa smos pa ni / don yod zhags pa'i las kyi phyag rgyas gzhug pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: The gesture of Amoghapasha is the inducting, and so on.

original: slob ma gzhug pa'i gnang ba nod pa'i mthar thug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma gzhug pa'i gnang ba nod pa'i mthar thug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa shes par bya'o //
translated: The extensive rite should be known, beginning with the inducting of the disciples, up to the request for permission.

original: dgug pa dang por byas pa gang yin pa nyid ni dgug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa bya'o //
analyzed: dgug pa dang por byas pa gang yin pa nyid ni dgug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa bya'o //
translated: The summoning, which was done first, is the extensive rite of summoning, and so on.

original: ji lta ba bzhin bcug ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin bcug ste /
translated: Having summoned them,

original: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni //
translated: one should say this:

analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis slob ma bcug la /
translated: Having inducted the disciples by the method of the Maṇḍala of Subjugation of Beings,

original: 'di khyod kyis su la yang ma brjod cig ces brjod la /
analyzed: 'di khyod kyis su la yang ma brjod cig ces brjod la /
translated: one should say, Do not tell this to anyone!

original: lhag ma ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i cho gas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i cho gas shes par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be known by the rite explained in the Maṇḍala of Subjugation of Beings.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyi las dang / slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyi las dang / slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the extensive rite of the master's acts and the induction of the disciples,🔽now, in order to explain the extensive rite of the secret initiation, [the Bhagavān] declares, the extensive rite of the secret initiation, and so on.

original: da ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor du dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams la 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dum bu thams cad las bshad pa'i dngos grub rnams slob dpon gyis bstan par bya'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan
analyzed: da ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor du dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams la 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dum bu thams cad las bshad pa'i dngos grub rnams slob dpon gyis bstan par bya'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of that,

original: pa'i phyir / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni slob ma 'jug pa'i dus phyis /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni slob ma 'jug pa'i dus phyis /
translated: “ Then” means after the time of inducting the disciples.

original: ye shes bskyed par bya ba'i bsgom pa'i gdams ngag sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes bskyed par bya ba'i bsgom pa'i gdams ngag sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The instruction for the meditation that generates gnosis should be given.

original: lag pas padmo bzung nas kyang //
analyzed: lag pas padmo bzung nas kyang //
translated: Holding the lotus with the hand,

original: zhes bya ba ni shing las byas pa'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa de gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shing las byas pa'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa de gzung ngo //
translated: one should hold the lotus made of wood with sixteen petals.

original: bsgoms te legs par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: bsgoms te legs par bsgom par bya //
translated: Meditating, one should meditate well.

original: zhes bya ba ni ting de 'dzin gyi stobs kyis padma'i dri des de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting de 'dzin gyi stobs kyis padma'i dri des de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one meditates on the power of samādhi, and offers the fragrance of the lotus to all tathāgatas, one will be successful.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i cho gas rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i cho gas rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: Having performed the yoga of one's deity by the rite explained in the great maṇḍala of Vinayaka,

original: phyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen pos padma @83b blangs te /
analyzed: phyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen pos padma @83b blangs te /
translated: later, with the great seal of Vinayaka, one takes up the lotus.

original: aom gandha p'u dza gra ghya s'a dha ya hri /
analyzed: aom gandha p'u dza gra ghya s'a dha ya hri /
translated: Reciting “Oṃ gandhapūjāgra ghya sādhaya hriḥ,”

original: zhes zlos shing ji srid du nyin re zhing thun bzhi'i sbyor bas mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgoms na /
analyzed: zhes zlos shing ji srid du nyin re zhing thun bzhi'i sbyor bas mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgoms na /
translated: to the extent that one meditates until one sees it directly, by the yoga of four sessions each day,

original: padma de las gdon mi za bar lha'i padma'i dri bro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma de las gdon mi za bar lha'i padma'i dri bro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: there is no doubt that the divine fragrance of the lotus will be smelled from that lotus.

original: de nas padma de ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor bas bsnams na /
analyzed: de nas padma de ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor bas bsnams na /
translated: Then, having smelled that lotus by the yoga of meditative concentration,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu gyur nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu gyur nas /
translated: all the tathāgatas become Avalokiteśvara,

original: padma la ched du non par bsnams te /
analyzed: padma la ched du non par bsnams te /
translated: and they smell the lotus with a special smell.

original: gang gi tshe mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgoms na des 'jig rten dbang phyug dang mtshungs pa'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //🔽mnyam par gzhag pas gnyug phud gtsug dbus //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgoms na des 'jig rten dbang phyug dang mtshungs pa'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro // mnyam par gzhag pas gnyug phud gtsug dbus //
translated: As long as one sees it in actuality, if one meditates on it, one will attain the power of being like Avalokiteśvara.

original: sangs rgyas gzugs ni rab gzhag pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs ni rab gzhag pa //
translated: The Buddha image is placed in the middle of the topknot of the coiled hair.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ral pa'i dbus su de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa rab tu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ral pa'i dbus su de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa rab tu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: This means that one should place the Tathāgata Amitābha in the middle of the coiled hair of Avalokiteśvara.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni sems g-yeng ba med pa'o //🔽'jig rten thams cad dbang du byed //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni sems g-yeng ba med pa'o // 'jig rten thams cad dbang du byed //
translated: “In equipoise” means without distraction.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'o //
translated: “One controls the entire world” means in all world systems.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽'gro zhing bsgyings pa bstan nas ni //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'gro zhing bsgyings pa bstan nas ni //
translated: How?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Having displayed the gait and bearing.”

original: de'i nga rgyal bsgom zhing bsgyings pas phyogs bcur rang gi gzugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pas ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal bsgom zhing bsgyings pas phyogs bcur rang gi gzugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pas ston pa'o //
translated: One displays one’s form in the ten directions, together with its retinue, through the cultivation of that pride and bearing.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: As before, one should perform the yoga of Noble Avalokiteśvara in the manner explained in the Great Mandala.

original: phyis aom padma mu ku ta ta th'a ga ta ba shi ku ru sarbba lo ke shva ra a'a be sha karmm'a ya ho /
analyzed: phyis aom padma mu ku ta ta th'a ga ta ba shi ku ru sarbba lo ke shva ra a'a be sha karmm'a ya ho /
translated: Then, reciting OṂ PADMA-MUKUṬA TATHĀGATA VAŚĪKURU SARVA-LOKEŚVARĀVIVAŚA-KARMA-YAH HO,

original: zhes zlos shing padma'i cod pan gyi dbus su gtsug phud sangs rgyas mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes zlos shing padma'i cod pan gyi dbus su gtsug phud sangs rgyas mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate until one actually sees the Buddha of the topknot in the center of the lotus crown.

original: de nas de'i ngo bor bstan par byas la /
analyzed: de nas de'i ngo bor bstan par byas la /
translated: Then, having made it manifest in that form,

original: de'i ngo bo des 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de'i rang bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo des 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de'i rang bzhin du bya'o //
translated: one should make the whole world have that nature.

original: padmo'i padmo gzugs chen por //
analyzed: padmo'i padmo gzugs chen por //
translated: The great form of the lotus of the lotus

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin padmo ni padmo yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin padmo ni padmo yin la /
translated: is the Blessed One’s samādhi lotus, which is a lotus.

original: de'i padmo ne padma'i padmo'o //
analyzed: de'i padmo ne padma'i padmo'o //
translated: The lotus of that is the lotus of the lotus.

original: rdo rje padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa kha dog dmar po padma des mtshan par byas pa ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa kha dog dmar po padma des mtshan par byas pa ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: The vajra lotus with sixteen petals, red in color, is marked with that lotus, which is to say, it is produced.

original: gang gis bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis bya zhe na /
translated: By what?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba smos te bsgoms pa sprul pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba smos te bsgoms pa sprul pa'o //
translated: It is said, “by means of samādhi,” that is, by means of the meditation of emanation.

original: ji bzhin tshul du 'dug nas su //
analyzed: ji bzhin tshul du 'dug nas su //
translated: “Having sat down in the proper manner”

original: zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor byas nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor byas nas so //
translated: means having performed the yoga of the deity.

original: yid kyis de ni gsad par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni ting @84a * //

translated: Then, having made them enter the mandala of the subjugation of the three worlds, one should make them look at the mandala with the words, I will show you the supreme mandala of the three worlds, which is the supreme abode of all the Tathagatas, the supreme abode of all the Bodhisattvas, the supreme abode of all the Vajra beings, the supreme abode of all the Lokapalas, and the supreme abode of all the gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, and so forth.🔽 Having said that, one should show them the mandala.🔽Then, having made them enter the mandala of the subjugation of the three worlds, one should make them look at the mandala with the words, I will show you the supreme mandala of the three worlds, which is the supreme abode of all the Tathagatas

original: de nas rang bzhin @85b gyis rnam par dag par bdag nyid bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas rang bzhin @85b gyis rnam par dag par bdag nyid bsgoms la /
translated: Then, having meditated on the nature of the self as naturally pure,🔽one should recite:

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /🔽de nas bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham / de nas bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nas /

original: padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa dang / sems can thams cad bdag nyid mnyam pa nyid bsgoms la /🔽aom sarbba sa mo ham /
analyzed: padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa dang / sems can thams cad bdag nyid mnyam pa nyid bsgoms la / aom sarbba sa mo ham /
translated: Then, having meditated on the sameness of the self with Vairocana and so forth, up to Padmanartteśvara, and the sameness of all sentient beings with the self,🔽one should recite:🔽Oṃ sarva samaṃ hūṃ.

original: aom s'a dha aa padma r'a ga sa ma ya aa /
analyzed: aom s'a dha aa padma r'a ga sa ma ya aa /
translated: Oṃ sādhya padmarāga samaya aḥ.

original: zhes lan gsum brjod do //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum brjod do //
translated: One should recite this three times.🔽Then, having generated the pride, The nature of the maṇḍala of Vinayaka is myself,

original: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ni bdag nyid dang yin no zhes da rgyal bskyed la /
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ni bdag nyid dang yin no zhes da rgyal bskyed la /
translated: one should recite:

original: aom h'um hri ho /
analyzed: aom h'um hri ho /
translated: Oṃ hūṃ hriḥ hoḥ.

original: zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: zhes brjod cing /
translated: One should recite this.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i rang bzhin du thun bzhi'i sbyor bas zla ba gcig gam zla ba drug gam /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i rang bzhin du thun bzhi'i sbyor bas zla ba gcig gam zla ba drug gam /
translated: Having meditated on the nature of the great maṇḍala of Vinayaka, one should practice in four sessions for one month, six months, or one year.

original: lo gcig tu 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i gzugs su bdag nyid mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bdag nyid kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lo gcig tu 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i gzugs su bdag nyid mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bdag nyid kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on oneself in this way until one sees oneself in the form of the great maṇḍala of Subduing Migrating Beings for one year.

original: de ltar 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po rab tu bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po rab tu bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus accomplished the great maṇḍala of Subduing Migrating Beings,

original: phyis ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum sgom pa /
analyzed: phyis ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum sgom pa /
translated: one should meditate on the three samādhis.

original: sngon du 'gre ba zhag bdun byas nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po bsgoms nas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du 'gre ba zhag bdun byas nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po bsgoms nas bri bar bya'o //
translated: Having performed the preliminary practice for seven days, one should draw the great maṇḍala of Subduing Migrating Beings after meditating on it.

original: gal te 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor bsgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor bsgrub par 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to accomplish the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī of Subduing Migrating Beings,

original: de nas sna ma bzhin du snying po lngas gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor sprul la /
analyzed: de nas sna ma bzhin du snying po lngas gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor sprul la /
translated: one should emanate the maṇḍala of the dhāraṇī with the five nectars as before.

original: gzungs kyi rig pa rnams kyis ji lta ba'i gnas rnams su gzungs rnams bzhag la /🔽aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: gzungs kyi rig pa rnams kyis ji lta ba'i gnas rnams su gzungs rnams bzhag la / aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
translated: One should place the dhāraṇīs in the places of the dhāraṇī awarenesses as before.🔽oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddho nyaham /🔽aom sarba sa mo ham /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddho nyaham / aom sarba sa mo ham /
translated: oṃ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ🔽oṃ sarva pāpaṃ deśayāmi

original: aom s'a dha ya padma r'a ga sa ma ya aa /
analyzed: aom s'a dha ya padma r'a ga sa ma ya aa /
translated: oṃ sādhaya padmarāga samayāḥ

original: zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du brjod pa dan /
analyzed: zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du brjod pa dan /
translated: As before, one should say, I am the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm.🔽Then, having meditated on oneself as the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm, one should say,🔽I am the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm.🔽Then, having meditated on oneself as the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm, one should say,🔽I am the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm.

analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du bdag nyid bsgoms la 'di skad ces brjod do ;
translated: Then, having meditated on oneself as the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm, one should say,🔽I am the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm.🔽Then, having meditated on oneself as the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm, one should say,

analyzed: /'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin ni bdag rang yin no zhes bya'o // de nas bzung te re re dang yang han cig bdag nyid dan tha mi dang par bsams te /
translated: I am the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm.🔽Then, having meditated on oneself as the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm, one should say,🔽I am the nature of the maṇḍala of the Vairocana of the Vajra realm.
